Eric Schmidt drew fire for responding to a hypothetical question posed at a forum in Washington, D.C., about an implant that would let Google Inc. know what its users were thinking. He responded that Google Inc. 's policy is to get right up to the creepy line and not cross it, and an implant would cross the line. But one thing that hasn't changed for the Democrat is that she feels comfortable in her state. I'm not worried about my safety, and I feel very safe everywhere in our state, and I feel safe doing my job, Kirsten Gillibrand said after visiting Gabrielle Giffords yesterday and seeing the remarkable strides she's made since a lunatic turned a mundane supermarket meet-and-greet into a scene of horror.
